intro: Memecylon agastyamalaianum, commonly known as the Nilgiri memecylon, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its opposite, lanceolate leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense tropical forests. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
